about.intro: The development of <celluloid>Celluloid</celluloid> is led by Michaël Bourgatte and Laurent Tessier within a multidisciplinary <consortium>Huma-Num Consortium</consortium> gathering researchers mobilizing audiovisual corpora.

opensource.github: Celluloid is an Open Source project in Digital Humanities. The code and the instructions for use are freely available on <github>GitHub</github>.
opensource.prefix: The version 2.0, "Alphaville", as well as its successive developments, are realized within the framework of the consortium Huma-Num <canevas>CANEVAS</canevas> (within the <mshpn>Maison des Sciences de l'Homme Paris Nord</mshpn>). This version is developed by Younès Benomar.

about.support: Version 1.0 of Celluloid, "Pierrot", as well as its successive developments, were supported by the Catholic University of Paris, Saint Matthieu Foundation and La Paillasse projects incubator. This version was developed by Erwan Queffélec with the participation of Jean-Frédéric Bruzek, Souleymane Thiam and Guillaume Aichhorn.
about.title: About

confirm-delete.title: Delete annotation

errors.ALREADY_EXISTING_PROJECT: A project with the same title already exists, please rename the project
errors.UNKNOWN: An unknown error has occurred. Please try again later or contact support for assistance.

home.addVideo: Add a link to a PeerTube video...
home.description: A webservice to annotate, comment and analyze audiovisual content (movies, series, TV shows or your own videos – interviews, ethnographic documentary…), alone or as a team
home.title: What is Celluloid ?

tutoriel.description:
Go to <peertube>Peertube</peertube>
Choose a video or upload a new one
Copy the link to share the video
Create your project in Celluloid, copy the video link and go!
Want to work with others? Share the project code with your partners
tutoriel.prefix: To discover the application, you can consult the
tutoriel.subtitle: You want to know more or you encounter difficulties?
tutoriel.title: How to use Celluloid ?

project.add-video-playlist-description: Please enter the URL of the video you would like to add to the playlist.
project.add-video-to-playlist-button: Add a video to the playlist.

annotaions.empty: The annotations corresponding to the different times of the video will be displayed here.

project.assignmentsHelper: List the tasks you submitt to the attendees

codeWarning.description:
This code will be available on the project page.
  To reset it, just reshare the project.
codeWarning.title: Share this code with the participants

project.collaborativeHelper: Attendees to a collaborative project will be allowed to annotate or comment the video. If your project is not collaborative, only you can annotate and comment on it.

error.video-info-failed: Failed to retrieve video information. Please check the URL and try again.

url.not-valid: The provided URL is not valid. Please check and try again.
url.required: URL is required. Please provide a valid URL.

project.publicHelper: A public project will be visible by all users, even logged-out. However, they won't be able to see the annotations and comments, nor to add their own.

dialog.description: To open printable instructions in a new widow

guide.step2: On the landing page, click 'JOIN PROJECT'
guide.step4: Enter your username and an answer to a secret question
guide.step5: Make sure to read carefully the objective and assignments
guide.step6: Complete the assignments and annotate the video while it's playing
guide.subtitle: How to use Celluloid ?
guide.title: Instructions
